nodes.name: Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA)
nodes.description: The Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA) is a comprehensive data privacy law that establishes consumer rights and data protection obligations for businesses operating in Virginia.

nodes.name: Trade and Commerce
nodes.description: Title 59.1 of the Virginia Code that encompasses various statutes related to trade and commerce, including the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA).

nodes.heading: Definitions
nodes.text: As used in this chapter...

nodes.heading: Scope; exemptions
nodes.text: This chapter applies to persons...

nodes.heading: Personal data rights; consumers
nodes.text: A consumer may invoke rights...

nodes.heading: Data controller responsibilities
nodes.text: Controller must limit collection...

nodes.heading: Responsibility according to role
nodes.text: Processor must adhere to instructions...

nodes.heading: Data protection assessments
nodes.text: Controller must conduct and document DPAs...

nodes.heading: De-identified data
nodes.text: Controller that possesses de-identified data...

nodes.heading: Enforcement
nodes.text: Any violation of this chapter...
Definitions applicable to the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA), including Consumer, Controller, Processor, Personal Data, Sensitive Data, and other key terms.
nodes.label: A

nodes.text: Scope of the VCDPA - applies to controllers and processors processing personal data of Virginia residents and meeting applicable thresholds.
nodes.label: A

nodes.text: Exemptions from VCDPA - government functions, HIPAA covered entities, GLBA regulated entities, and other specified exemptions.
nodes.label: B

nodes.text: Consumer rights under VCDPA - right to confirm and access, correct, delete, obtain portability, and opt out of targeted advertising, sale, and profiling.
nodes.label: A

nodes.text: Exercise of rights - consumers may submit authenticated requests; controllers must respond within 45 days, extendable to 90 days.
nodes.label: B

nodes.text: Appeals process - consumers may appeal a refusal or partial fulfillment of a rights request.
nodes.label: C

nodes.text: Controller duties regarding security - establish, implement, and maintain reasonable administrative, technical, and physical data security practices.
nodes.label: A

nodes.text: Controller duties regarding notice - provide clear, reasonably accessible privacy notice at or before collection of personal data.
nodes.label: B

nodes.text: Privacy notice content - must disclose categories of personal data, purposes, rights exercise methods, data sharing, and opt-out mechanisms.
nodes.label: C

nodes.text: Processor requirements - must process personal data only on instructions from the controller and for limited purposes.
nodes.label: A

nodes.text: Data processing agreement - required contract between controller and processor with specified mandatory terms.
nodes.label: B

nodes.text: Data Protection Assessment (DPA) requirement - controllers must conduct DPA for targeted advertising, sales, profiling, and sensitive data processing.
nodes.label: A

nodes.text: DPA content - must assess benefits and risks of processing, consider alternatives, and document findings.
nodes.label: B

nodes.text: Enforcement authority - Virginia Attorney General has exclusive enforcement power under VCDPA.
nodes.label: A

nodes.text: Cure period - 30-day mandatory period for controllers to remedy violations after receiving notice from Attorney General.
nodes.label: B

nodes.text: Civil penalties - up to $7,500 per violation for uncured or continued violations of VCDPA.
nodes.label: C

nodes.name: Controller
nodes.description: Natural or legal person that determines purpose and means of processing

nodes.name: Processor
nodes.description: Entity processing personal data on behalf of controller

nodes.name: Consumer
nodes.description: Virginia resident acting in individual or household context

nodes.name: Child
nodes.description: Natural person younger than 13 years of age

nodes.name: Parent or Legal Guardian
nodes.description: Parent or legal guardian of a child

nodes.name: Third Party
nodes.description: Person other than consumer controller processor or affiliates

nodes.name: Virginia Attorney General
nodes.description: Sole enforcement authority for VCDPA

nodes.name: Personal Data
nodes.description: Information linked to identified or identifiable natural person

nodes.name: Racial or Ethnic Origin
nodes.description: Personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin

nodes.name: Religious Beliefs
nodes.description: Personal data revealing religious beliefs

nodes.name: Health Diagnosis
nodes.description: Personal data revealing mental or physical health diagnosis

nodes.name: Sexual Orientation
nodes.description: Personal data revealing sexual orientation

nodes.name: Citizenship Status
nodes.description: Personal data revealing citizenship or immigration status

nodes.name: Genetic or Biometric ID
nodes.description: Processing genetic or biometric data for unique identification

nodes.name: Child Data
nodes.description: Personal data collected from known child under 13

nodes.name: Precise Geolocation
nodes.description: Precise geolocation within 1750 feet radius

nodes.name: De-identified Data
nodes.description: Data cannot reasonably be linked to identified person

nodes.description: Consumer requests to confirm and access personal data

nodes.name: Correction Request

nodes.name: Deletion Request

nodes.name: Data Portability Request
nodes.description: Consumer requests portable copy in usable format

nodes.name: Opt-Out Sale
nodes.description: Consumer opts out of sale of personal data

nodes.name: Opt-Out Profiling
nodes.description: Consumer opts out of profiling with legal effects

nodes.name: Consent for Sensitive Data
nodes.description: Controller obtains consent for sensitive data processing

nodes.name: Consumer Appeal
nodes.description: Consumer appeals controller refusal to act

nodes.name: DPA Required
nodes.description: Event triggering data protection assessment

nodes.name: Data Minimization
nodes.description: Limit collection to adequate relevant and necessary

nodes.name: Purpose Limitation
nodes.description: Process only for reasonably necessary and compatible purposes

nodes.name: Security Practices
nodes.description: Reasonable administrative technical and physical security

nodes.name: Non-Discrimination
nodes.description: Do not discriminate against consumers exercising rights

nodes.name: Consent Mechanism
nodes.description: Obtain clear affirmative consent for sensitive data

nodes.name: Privacy Notice
nodes.description: Provide accessible clear meaningful privacy notice

nodes.name: Opt-Out Disclosure
nodes.description: Disclose sale and targeted advertising with opt-out

nodes.name: Consumer Request Mechanism
nodes.description: Secure reliable means for submitting requests

nodes.name: Authentication
nodes.description: Authenticate consumer identity commercially reasonable

nodes.name: Appeal Process
nodes.description: Process for consumers to appeal refusal

nodes.name: Processor Contract
nodes.description: Binding contract with processor

nodes.name: DPA Documentation
nodes.description: Conduct and document data protection assessments
AG must provide 30-day notice and cure opportunity
AG may seek penalties up to $7,500 per violation if not cured
AG may seek injunction to restrain violations
AG investigates consumer complaints and violations
AG sends formal notice of violation and requires corrective action
Documented record of VCDPA violation maintained by AG
Consumer files complaint with Virginia Attorney General for investigation
Negotiated settlement between AG and violating entity

nodes.name: 100,000 Consumers Threshold
nodes.description: Controls or processes data of 100,000+ consumers

nodes.name: 25,000 + 50% Revenue Threshold
nodes.description: Controls 25,000+ consumers AND >50% revenue from data sales

nodes.name: State Agencies
nodes.description: State agencies and political subdivisions

nodes.name: GLBA Financial Institutions
nodes.description: Financial institutions under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act

nodes.name: HIPAA Entities
nodes.description: HIPAA covered entities and business associates

nodes.name: Nonprofit Organizations
nodes.description: Nonprofit organizations exempt under IRS 501(c)

nodes.name: Higher Education
nodes.description: Public and private institutions of higher education

nodes.text: Natural person who is a resident of the Commonwealth acting only in an individual or household context (and not acting in a commercial or employment context).
Natural or legal person that, alone or jointly with others, determines the purpose and means of processing personal data.
Natural or legal person that processes personal data on behalf of a controller.
Any information that is linked or reasonably linkable to an identified or identifiable natural person.

A category of personal data including racial or ethnic origin, religious beliefs, mental or physical health diagnosis, sexual orientation, citizenship or immigration status, genetic or biometric data for identification, personal data collected from a known child, and precise geolocation data.

Displaying advertisements to a consumer where the advertisement is selected based on personal data obtained from that consumer's activities over time and across nonaffiliated websites or online applications to predict such consumer's preferences or interests.
The exchange of personal data for monetary consideration by the controller to a third party.

Any form of automated processing performed on personal data to evaluate, analyze, or predict personal aspects concerning an identified or identifiable natural person, where such profiling produces legal or similarly significant effects.
A clear affirmative act signifying a consumer's freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous agreement to the processing of personal data.

An assessment of the benefits that may flow, directly and indirectly, from processing to the controller, consumer, other stakeholders, and the public, as compared against the potential risks to the rights of the consumer associated with that processing activity.

nodes.name: Right to Confirm and Access
nodes.description: Right to confirm whether a controller is processing the consumer's personal data and to access such data.

nodes.name: Right to Correct
nodes.description: Right to correct inaccuracies in the consumer's personal data, taking into account the nature of the personal data and the purposes of the processing.

nodes.name: Right to Delete
nodes.description: Right to delete personal data provided by or obtained about the consumer.

nodes.name: Right to Data Portability
nodes.description: Right to obtain a copy of personal data in a portable and, to the extent technically feasible, readily usable format.

nodes.name: Right to Opt Out
nodes.description: Right to opt out of the processing of personal data for purposes of targeted advertising, the sale of personal data, or profiling in furtherance of decisions that produce legal or similarly significant effects.

nodes.scope: Individual/Household only (excludes employment and commercial contexts)
nodes.description: Virginia resident acting in an individual or household context.
Duty to respond to authenticated consumer rights requests without undue delay and within 45 days, extendable once by an additional 45 days when reasonably necessary, as set out in § 59.1-577.
Individual acting in an employment or commercial context, excluded from the definition of consumer under VCDPA.

nodes.name: Sensitive Data
nodes.description: A category of personal data including racial or ethnic origin, religious beliefs, mental or physical health diagnosis, sexual orientation, citizenship or immigration status, genetic or biometric data for identification, personal data collected from a known child, and precise geolocation data.

nodes.name: Personal Data
nodes.description: Any information that is linked or reasonably linkable to an identified or identifiable natural person under VCDPA.

nodes.name: Racial or Ethnic Origin
nodes.description: Sensitive data revealing a consumer's racial or ethnic origin.

nodes.name: Religious Beliefs
nodes.description: Sensitive data revealing a consumer's religious beliefs.

nodes.name: Mental or Physical Health Diagnosis
nodes.description: Sensitive data concerning a consumer's mental or physical health diagnosis.

nodes.name: Sexual Orientation
nodes.description: Sensitive data revealing a consumer's sexual orientation.

nodes.name: Citizenship or Immigration Status
nodes.description: Sensitive data revealing a consumer's citizenship or immigration status.

nodes.name: Genetic or Biometric Data
nodes.description: Genetic or biometric data processed for the purpose of uniquely identifying a natural person.

nodes.name: Child Data
nodes.description: Personal data collected from a known child under the age of 13.

nodes.name: Precise Geolocation Data
nodes.description: Precise geolocation data identifying a consumer's location within a radius of 1,750 feet.
Opt-in consent required before processing sensitive data under VCDPA

nodes.name: Targeted Advertising
nodes.description: Displaying advertisements to a consumer where the advertisement is selected based on personal data obtained from that consumer's activities over time and across nonaffiliated websites or applications to predict preferences or interests.

nodes.name: Sale of Personal Data
nodes.description: Exchange of personal data for monetary consideration by the controller to a third party.

nodes.name: Profiling
nodes.description: Automated processing of personal data to evaluate or predict aspects relating to a consumer, where such profiling produces legal or similarly significant effects.

nodes.name: Sensitive Data Processing
nodes.description: Processing of sensitive data, including health, biometric, child, and precise geolocation data.

nodes.name: General Processing
nodes.description: General collection, use, storage, disclosure, analysis, or deletion of personal data by the controller.

nodes.name: VCDPA Controller Privacy Notice
nodes.description: Privacy notice required under VCDPA § 59.1-578(C), describing categories of personal data processed, purposes, how consumers may exercise their rights and appeal, categories of personal data shared, categories of third parties, and disclosures regarding sale or targeted advertising.
Statutory cure period during which a controller or processor may remedy a VCDPA violation after receiving a notice from the Virginia Attorney General, as provided in Va. Code § 59.1-584.
Civil penalty of up to $7,500 per violation that the Attorney General may seek for uncured or continued violations of VCDPA.
Civil investigative demand issued by the Virginia Attorney General to obtain information relevant to a potential VCDPA violation.
Court-ordered injunction sought by the Virginia Attorney General to enjoin a controller or processor from violating VCDPA.

nodes.name: Generic Controller
nodes.description: Entity that determines the purpose and means of processing personal data under VCDPA.

nodes.name: Online Retailer
nodes.description: Controller offering products or services to Virginia residents via online channels.

nodes.name: Cloud Processor
nodes.description: Processor providing cloud hosting and data storage services under controller instructions.

nodes.name: Analytics Processor
nodes.description: Processor performing analytics and reporting on personal data on behalf of controllers.

nodes.name: Virginia Attorney General
nodes.description: Exclusive enforcement authority for the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA).
Notice of violation issued by the Virginia Attorney General describing alleged non-compliance with VCDPA and triggering the 30-day cure period.

nodes.name: Consumer Data Protection Act
nodes.description: Chapter 53 of Title 59.1 containing the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA), establishing comprehensive consumer privacy rights and business obligations.
Commercial or B2B context that is excluded from the definition of consumer under VCDPA.
Data that cannot reasonably be linked to an identified or identifiable natural person, taking into account reasonable measures to ensure de-identification and public commitments not to re-identify.
Information that is lawfully made available through government records or widely distributed media, and thus treated as publicly available information under VCDPA.

nodes.name: Consumer Rights Request Process
nodes.description: Internal process used by the controller to receive, authenticate, and respond to consumer requests to exercise their VCDPA rights, including appeals of refusals.

nodes.section_id: Controller must establish, implement, and maintain reasonable administrative, technical, and physical data security practices to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and accessibility of personal data.
nodes.description: Reasonable Security Measures
Clear affirmative act signifying a consumer's freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous agreement to the processing of sensitive data.

nodes.required_terms: Confidentiality; Deletion or Return of Data; Audit Rights; Subcontractor Flow-down
nodes.name: Standard Processor Agreement

nodes.required_terms: Security Measures; Breach Notification; Cross-border Transfer Mechanisms
nodes.name: Cloud Infrastructure Addendum

nodes.description: Controller could not authenticate consumer identity using commercially reasonable methods
Data processed is subject to HIPAA/GLBA exemption
Request is manifestly unfounded, excessive, or repetitive

nodes.name: Discrimination
nodes.description: Unfair or deceptive treatment; unlawful disparate impact on consumers

nodes.name: Financial Loss
nodes.description: Unauthorized disclosure leading to financial fraud or identity theft

nodes.name: Reputational Injury
nodes.description: Exposure of private affairs that would be offensive to a reasonable person

nodes.name: Physical Intrusion
nodes.description: Physical or other intrusion upon solitude or seclusion

nodes.name: False Hierarchy
nodes.description: Visual interference prioritizing 'Accept' over 'Reject'

nodes.name: Nagging
nodes.description: Repeated consent requests interrupting user flow

nodes.name: Trick Questions
nodes.description: Confusing language making users unsure of their choice

nodes.required_content: Express written statement that violations have been cured and no further violations shall occur

nodes.description: Natural person under 13 years of age
Detecting security incidents; protecting against malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity
Providing a product or service specifically requested by a consumer
Complying with federal, state, or local laws and regulations

nodes.controls: Kept separate from identification keys; subject to technical controls

nodes.name: Online Opt-Out Link
nodes.description: Web or app interface allowing consumers to opt out of targeted advertising, the sale of personal data, or profiling that produces legal or similarly significant effects, as disclosed in the privacy notice.

nodes.name: Ad Network
nodes.description: Third party receiving personal data for advertising and measurement purposes.

nodes.name: Data Broker
nodes.description: Third party purchasing personal data from controllers for resale or enrichment.

nodes.text: Information security management
Privacy impact assessment
Contracts with PII processors
Data protection policies (Security)
Inventory and Mapping (Contracts)
Information to be provided where personal data collected from data subject
Information regarding PII processing
Governance policies (Privacy Notice)

Both require data minimization and purpose limitation

rels.description: Processor processes personal data on behalf of and under instructions of Controller
Processor acts as service provider to Controller for data processing activities
Processor provides services requiring access to personal data controlled by Controller
Processor engages subcontractor with general written authorization from Controller
Processor engages subcontractor with specific prior written authorization from Controller
Processor must impose same data protection obligations on subcontractor via contract
